Description: Fragment of Attic black-figured pottery lid. Two women back to back (preserved: the upper part of the left woman from eye to mid-thigh, all of the right woman except her feet). The right woman holds her himation to her face. Added white for the left hand of the woman standing to right; added red for both women's himatia. Above, three lines and the tip of a ray. On the black glazed interior, a narrow white band at the widest part of the fragment, and two more near the bottom break.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 85 no. 283 pl. 63)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2113)
